_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name                  | Process Chemical           | Process Quantity(lbs.)

Sulfur Dioxide                  Sulfur Dioxide               8,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulat

ion to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Description



1.2.1 Facility Overview



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator operates a grape dehydrating facility that utilizes sulfur dioxide chambers for color preservation in the fruit drying process. Sulfur dioxide is piped from a ton-container to each chamber using pipe and ball valves. When in use, each chamber receives 80-90 lb of sulfur dioxide gas.



1.2.2 Facility Location



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator is located at 26783 Road 176, Exeter, CA 93221. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 36.274861, -119.183722. The facility is located approximately 5 miles south of state highway 198 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agricultural land.



According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area with a "0.2 pct annual chance flood hazard". The minimal chance of flood hazard does not pose an imminent threat to the sulfur dioxide process equipment.



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has a <1% chance of experiencing "potentially minor-damage" due to ground shaking in 2018.



1.2.3 Description of Covered Process



The sulfur dioxide process at National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator consists of a storage area for ton containers and an injection area where sulfur dioxide is added to the chambers an

d consumed:

Full sulfur dioxide ton containers are delivered and secured in the storage area by the vendor. 



The container is connected to an injection manifold and opened. As needed, isolation valves for the chambers are opened and either 80 lb (Chambers 2-12) or 90 lb (Chambers 13-24) of sulfur dioxide is injected into a chamber. 



The sulfur dioxide is consumed by the product. When the proper amount of sulfur dioxide has been injected into the chamber the isolation valve for the chamber is closed. 

Empty containers are picked up by the vendor for refilling.



Process Chemistry



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator utilizes sulfur dioxide (SO2) as an antioxidant to protect the color and flavor in the dried fruit products that are produced. The sulfur dioxide is injected into the sulfur dioxide chambers through piping connected to a sulfur dioxide ton container. All sulfur dioxide gas permeates into the fruit and acts as a color preserving agent. 



Safety Systems



Secure Container Storage

All ton containers are chocked and stored securely in a designated storage area.



Signage

Sulfur-dioxide storage areas and piping are clearly marked.



Protective Clothing

Personnel engaged in operations that will be subject to high or unknown concentrations of sulfur-dioxide will be provided with protective gloves, safety glasses, boots, pants, and/or a long sleeve shirt that are impervious to sulfur-dioxide.



Local Exhaust

Local exhaust ventilation is used when there is potential exposure to sulfur dioxide levels in excess of allowable standards.



Fencing

The sulfur-dioxide storage area is fenced with barbed wire on top of the fence to guard against trespassing. The fence is locked when unoccupied.



Gas Detector

A portable sulfur-dioxide gas detector is used by applicators throughout the duration of the gassing process.



Respirator

All applicators are equipped with a half-face cartridge respirator that must be worn throughout the duration of the gass

ing process.



Fusible Plugs

Each sulfur dioxide ton container at National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator is protected from overpressure with three (3) fusible plugs on each side of the container (6 total). The fusible plugs consist of a brass plug with a fusible metal insert that is designed to melt between 157?F-170?F.



Emergency Eyewash and Safety Shower Station

Emergency eyewash and safety showers are located in various areas throughout the facility and can be used to decontaminate if chemical exposure occurs.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of sulfur dioxide in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the sulfur dioxide process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Sulfur-Dioxide



The sulfur-dioxide process at the National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator facility is an integral part of overall business and lasts for approximately two months out of the year. The sulfur-dioxide process contains multiple cylinders with a maximum inventory of [8,000 (lbs.)]. It is extremely important that these areas and associated injection processes are maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur-dioxide.



Our personnel also monitor the sulfur-dioxide fumigation process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions. In addition, the process is checked frequently during the season by the ou

tside contractor that supplies the SO2 cylinders. The contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our process equipment. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- Cal/OSHA's Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38

- Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 8 CCR ?5189(n)

- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]- Title 29 CFR ?1910.119(n)

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 ?2765.1-2765.2

- USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 40 CFR ?68.95

- California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures] - Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 ?2731

- California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

- Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has impl

emented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program National Raisin Exeter Dehydrator will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
